TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PowerBroadcastStatus extends System.Enum

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus> is used by the <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceBase> class to indicate a change in the system's power status. You can design your application to react to any power status change.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus BatteryLow = int32(9)
.field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus OemEvent = int32(11)

Docs.summary: An Advanced Power Management (APM) BIOS signaled an APM OEM event.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus PowerStatusChange = int32(10)

Docs.summary: A change in the power status of the computer is detected, such as a switch from battery power to A/C. The system also broadcasts this event when remaining battery power slips below the threshold specified by the user or if the battery power changes by a specified percentage.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus QuerySuspend = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The system has requested permission to suspend the computer. An application that grants permission should carry out preparations for the suspension before returning.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus QuerySuspendFailed = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The system was denied permission to suspend the computer. This status is broadcast if any application or driver denied a previous status.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus ResumeAutomatic = int32(18)

Docs.summary: The computer has woken up automatically to handle an event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > If the system detects any user activity after broadcasting `ResumeAutomatic`, it will broadcast a `ResumeSuspend` event to let applications know they can resume full interaction with the user.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus ResumeCritical = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The system has resumed operation after a critical suspension caused by a failing battery.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > Because a critical suspension occurs without prior notification, resources and data previously available may not be present when the application receives this event. The application should attempt to restore its state to the best of its ability.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus ResumeSuspend = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The system has resumed operation after being suspended.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.PowerBroadcastStatus Suspend = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The computer is about to enter a suspended state. This event is typically broadcast when all applications and installable drivers have returned to a previous state.
